reference.scope: X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.8 ANGSTROMS) OF 89-252 (ISOFORM 2) IN COMPLEX WITH SUBSTRATE ANALOG AND MAGNESIUM IONS

comment.text: This enzyme is involved in nucleotide metabolism: it produces dUMP, the immediate precursor of thymidine nucleotides and it decreases the intracellular concentration of dUTP so that uracil cannot be incorporated into DNA.

kinetics.text: kM is identical for both isoform 2 and isoform 3.

comment.text: Pyrimidine metabolism; dUMP biosynthesis; dUMP from dCTP (dUTP route): step 2/2.

Found in a variety of tissues. Isoform 3 expression is constitutive, while isoform 2 expression correlates with the onset of DNA replication (at protein level). Isoform 2 degradation coincides with the cessation of nuclear DNA replication (at protein level).

Nuclear isoform 2 is phosphorylated in vivo on Ser-11, a reaction that can be catalyzed in vitro by CDC2. Phosphorylation in mature T-cells occurs in a cell cycle-dependent manner. Isoform 3 is not phosphorylated.
Each trimer binds three substrate molecules. The ligands are bound between subunits, and for each substrate molecule, residues from adjacent subunits contribute to the binding interactions.

property.value: Interconversion of nucleotide di- and triphosphates
Expressed in liver and 259 other tissues

feature.description: dUTP; via amide nitrogen and carbonyl oxygen
